title: Introducing VEHICLES to R.E.P.O.
contents: Hey hey semibots! It‚Äôs Friday and that means a devlog for you guys! For those of you who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video, here‚Äôs the key takeaways: INTRODUCING VEHICLES Together with cosmetics, we‚Äôre introducing vehicles to R.E.P.O. A fun and speedy way to traverse the level. The Semiscooter can be purchased in the shop. We are looking into a system where vehicles gets damaged over time and has to get repaired (instead of having a battery like other items). Adding vehicles to R.E.P.O. also opens up a creative door for future levels, where we can adapt and have vehicles in mind when designing them. Other fun stuff is coming as well, but more will be revealed in the final devlog of the year, launching next Friday. Have a lovely, beautiful weekend! You deserve it! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: 'If you happen to love microtransactions, I am going to disappoint you deeply': REPO's next update is revealing deets, and it's more exciting than monsters
contents: It feels like only yesterday semiwork announced that the team would be taking a break before working on the next update. Which isn't actually entirely inaccurate as it's been less than a month and we're already got the first video about the next release. So, it looks like we won't have to wait too long before REPO receives its next batch of content after all, and in my opinion, it's the most exciting one yet... Read more.

title: LEAKING THE NEXT R.E.P.O. UPDATE!!
contents: Hey hey semibots! We‚Äôre back with another juicy devlog for you all! For those of you who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video, here‚Äôs the key takeaways: THE NEXT UPDATE REVEALED - Cosmetics (And other fun stuff) is finally coming to R.E.P.O. - Cosmetics will be 100% free and earned by simply playing the game - no microtransactions whatsoever. - We are working hard to make sure cosmetics feel like a natural integrated part of the gameplay experience, as we want the hunt for cosmetics to be exciting! GOLDEN JOYSTICK AWARDS - We got ourselves a win in the ‚ÄúBest Early Access Game‚Äù category and we are so thankful to everyone who voted! ‚ù§Ô∏è REMINDER ABOUT DEVLOGS - Friendly reminder that devlogs does NOT affect the development of the game, as we have separate teams working on each. You do not ever have to worry, regardless of the posting frequency, that videos negatively impact the game‚Äôs development. - These videos are important to us as they let us communicate directly with you, our community, and getting frequent feedback from you guys is extremely valuable to us ‚ù§Ô∏è Bye bye! /semiwork

title: R.E.P.O. v0.3.2
contents: Hey hey semibots! FIXES Tumble Climb - Initial stamina drain now only affects the player who started climbing. Bye bye! /semiwork

title: Vote R.E.P.O. for the "Better With Friends" award!!
contents: Hey hey semibots! We just won the "Best Early Access" award at the Golden Joystick Awards, thank you so much to everyone who voted, we could not be any more grateful for our amazing community!! {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/45481982/95773536bd469a2410bfce8b875a2238b10517e0.jpg With that said... could be cool to win the "Better With Friends" Steam Award as well... ‚ù§Ô∏è {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/45481982/91e954f42347b8c2481e2190b8c915a59a266912.png We really appreciate you all and are hard at work on our next update, thank you!! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: R.E.P.O. v0.3.1
contents: Hey hey semibots! NEW CHANGES BALANCING FIXES NEW New Setting - Arachnophobia (sorry!) CHANGES Toggle Grab - Items are no longer dropped when opening the pause menu. Upgrade Tumble Launch - Renamed "Launch" to "Tumble Launch" for consistency in UI. BALANCING Tumble Climb - Stronger. Now scales with range upgrades. Consumes a percentage of max stamina, more upgrades will still lower stamina cost. Consumes a small stamina burst at the start of each grab. Acts more like a grappling hook now. Slightly more expensive in the shop. Enemy Gambit - Money bag prize is now worth more. Enemy Bella - Now attacks for half as long. Only rings bell at players she can reach. Bell ring count resets faster. Enemy Loom - Does not give up while near players anymore, unless stuck or can't reach the player. Death Head Battery Upgrade - Reduced diminishing returns when stacking multiple upgrades. Valuable Arctic Sample Cooler Wide (McJannek Station) - Increased weight and value. Valuable Arctic Centrifuge (McJannek Station) - Increased weight and value. Valuable Arctic Icepick (McJannek Station) - Increased weight and can now spawn in more spots. Valuable Arctic VHS (McJannek Station) - Decreased value. FIXES Enemies - Corrected required grab force for some enemies. Enemy Loom - Fixed not hurt by physical impacts. Fixed her not always targeting the correct player when grabbed or touched with an object. Fixed attacking through doors. Fixed screen effect not always showing when a player got targeted. Enemy Elsa - Fixed "Big" Elsa being very slow running up stairs. Fixed not always playing their pet effects. Fixed being pet while flying back out of a pit causing them to fall down the pit again. Enemy Bella - Now correctly despawns if stuck. Enemy Tick - Fixed being ungrabbed when opening the pause menu. Fixed sometimes spinning in spot. Fixed having some trouble getting up stairs. Enemy Heart Hugger - Fixed multiple Heart Huggers able to stun lock the player forever. Enemy Birthday Boy - Fixed sometimes running in spot. Fixed balloons not being poppable by bullets. Map - Fixed being unable to open map whilst betrayal TTS was active. Arena - Fixed bug where possessed Death Heads that fell out of the level didn't return to normal spectate. Level Loading - Reduced game freezes during level loading for the lobby host. Splash Screen - Fixed not showing when game is opened by accepting a lobby invite. Upgrade Death Head Battery - Fixed first upgrade not having any effect. Items - Fixed unequipping an item not releasing tumble climb. Fixed unequipping an item preventing picking up other items for a few seconds. Item Feather Drone - Fixed large affected items being very difficult to rotate precisely. Item Phase Bridge - Now much more stable for clients to walk on in its "static" state. Truck Healer - Fixed healing before fully activated. Player Health Sharing - Fixed a bug where sharing would get stuck if interrupted by being tumbled into. Network - Updated networked assets to hopefully lower the amount of "Client Time Outs". Level - Various fixes. Bye bye! /semiwork

title: Planning for REPO's next update is underway, but the developer is taking a break for the time being: 'Frankly, my brain is a bit mushy'
contents: REPO launched its monster update on October 31, adding ten new horrifying beasts to the already tense game. However, even though players are still mastering the art of dodging the Birthday Boy's balloons and outrunning the Loom, semiwork has already uploaded a video to YouTube sharing that preparations for the game's next update are underway... Read more.

title: NEXT R.E.P.O. UPDATE?!
contents: Hey hey semibots! First off, we want to extend a big THANK YOU to the entire community, it‚Äôs been a blast watching you guys play The Monster Update! In today‚Äôs video we‚Äôre providing some important information about the near future! For those of you who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video, here‚Äôs the key takeaways: THE NEXT UPDATE We are preparing to decide upon what the next update should be all about, and we‚Äôd like to hear from you guys what you want to see in the next update! Let us know in the YouTube comments, or maybe on the official R.E.P.O. Discord ‚Äì let your voice be heard! HOTFIX INCOMING We‚Äôre reading and listening to your feedback regarding the Monster Update and we are working on a hotfix to address the most concerning stuff. We are adding an Arachnophobia Mode, tweaks to enemies and valuables and lots of other stuff! It‚Äôs coming soon! DEVLOGS/VIDEOS ARE GOING ON A BREAK As we‚Äôve fed you guys with a lot of videos and announcements during October, we are taking a little break from posting videos. In the meantime, make sure you are subscribed to the YouTube Channel or follow our Discord so you don‚Äôt miss out on when we return ‚Äì because when we do, we‚Äôll announce what the next update will be all about! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: REPO's monster update has arrived, and it is so much scarier than I thought it would be all because of one beast
contents: When REPO announced it would be receiving a bunch of new monsters in September, I naively thought they wouldn't be too scary. Most of REPO's existing critters are unsettling, especially the Upscream and the Animal, but there's nothing that really petrifies you. The same can't be said for the game now though, and having spent the weekend running for my life and screaming over proximity chat, REPO really lives up to its horror tag... Read more.

title: THE MONSTER UPDATE IS UNLEASHED!
contents: Hey hey semibots! As of yesterday, the MONSTER UPDATE has been released upon the world, with 10 brand new monsters, new mechanics and other new fun stuff to enjoy! In today‚Äôs devlog, we‚Äôre going through the main additions of the update, while also showing you an in-depth BEHIND THE SCENES of the creation of our live action launch trailer! Patch Notes https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/3241660/view/511846967442148737 IMPORTANT HAPPENINGS It is currently FREE WEEKEND, which means you can play R.E.P.O. for free until November 3rd! (after that you have to buy the game as normal) We have a Discord Quest active, check it out here: https://discordapp.com/quests/1432436088508780675 Last chance to get the SEMIBOT outfit in Fortnite! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: You can now twerk enemies to death in Repo thanks to the big new Monster Update‚Äîand it's free to play this weekend to celebrate
contents: Repo's Monster Update‚Äîthat's literally what it's called, unless you want to roll with the far more snooze-inducing v0.3.0‚Äîis now live on Steam. As promised it's a big one, with new upgrades, valuables, rooms to explore, and enemies to deal with‚Äîand, as PC Gamer's very own Repo man Lincoln Carter is especially excited about, "butt physics.".. Read more.

title: R.E.P.O. v0.3.0 - The Monster Update
contents: Hey hey semibots! Our second major update is now live, The Monster Update! Hope you guys have fun with all the new content! ‚ù§Ô∏è NEW CHANGES BALANCING FIXES NEW 10 new enemies! Death Head Possession - Added battery that recharges while dead! Spend your battery charge to possess your head and interact with the living. Tumble Grab - While tumbled you can now grab objects, items and weapons! New Upgrade - Death Head Battery! New Upgrade - Tumble Climb! Swift Broom Academy - 24 new valuables! Headman Manor - 8 new valuables! McJannek Station - 22 new valuables! Museum of Human Art - 20 new rooms! Headman Manor - 2 new rooms! Swiftbroom Academy - 1 new room! Truck Chat - Added more Tax Man messages! Steam - Rich presence now shows the current level name and level number, and friends in the same lobby appear as a group. Discord Rich Presence - See and join your friends' games directly from Discord! New Setting "Item Unequip Auto Hold" - Toggle auto grab for unequipped items. Defaults to "on" for existing players and "off" for new players! Save Menu - Added "Restore from Backup" button to recover corrupted save files from the latest backup. Also added the ability to name save files! CHANGES Valuables - All levels now have unique valuables, no sharing between levels anymore! Music - Updated Main Menu music! Ambience - Many rooms now feature new ambient sounds. Player Damage - Players are now immune during level outro animation. Upgrade Crouch Rest - Now also triggers when in Tumble state and stationary. Truck Chat - Displays remaining Extractions instead of money left when trying to leave early, and hints at multiple Extractions if the next point is inactive. Truck Healer - Now activates after final extraction fully completes. Water - Non-lethal water appears less radioactive. Headman Manor - Added window curtains and new flooring to some modules. Some props now have improved textures! McJannek Station - Some props now have improved textures! Swiftbroom Academy - Some props now have improved textures! Shop - Updated car models. Overcharge UI - Bar now appears more fully charged before impact. Save Files - Slight optimization to reduce file size when storing many players. BALANCING Enemy Shadow Child - Deals more damage and yanks players harder. Phase Bridge - Now remains where released, suspended mid air, and auto-aligns for easier walking. Roll Drone and Zero Gravity Drone - Lowered battery drain penalty when drones are attached to enemies. FIXES Player - Fixed rare spots where players could get stuck and couldn't jump. Fixed bug where revived players could fall through the level after being revived. Phys Grabber - Fixed grabbed item movement degrading when strength exceeded 90. Enemies - Fixed rare bug causing enemies to spin endlessly after grabbed by multiple players. Enemies - Fixed rare spots where enemies could get stuck and couldn't jump. Improved jump logic to reduce accidental jumps into pits. Enemy Bowtie - Fixed bug where yelling particles lingered after death. Enemy Chef - Fixed bug where players could be hurt through walls. Enemy Peeper - Fixed bug where forced grab release ended sooner than intended. C.A.R.T. - Fixed bug where disconnecting while holding C.A.R.T. prevented it from resetting. Fixed being able to steer whilst inside it. C.A.R.T. Cannon - No longer disables while in the extraction point. Item Battery - Fixed bug where some items granted more uses than displayed pips on first purchase. Items - Fixed rare bug where equipped item light lingered. Upgrades - Fixed particles not always visible to clients when a player uses an upgrade. Truck - Fixed countdown failing to start if a player exited after entering. Shop - Fixed inventory items sometimes duplicating when dying in the shop. Fixed grenades and the explosive mine not being ungrabbed on explosion. Fixed trapzap not resetting properly. UI - Fixed health and energy counters overlapping the max value when above 999. Save Menu - Fixed moon level sometimes showing the wrong moon graphic. Fixed corrupted saves hiding other saves. Menu now correctly deletes more types of corrupted files. Save File Deletion - Fixed bug deleting saves when entire team died, revived, and host quit the game. Valuable Discover - Fixed issue causing valuables on ledges to be undiscoverable from low angles. Aim Cursor - Now hides while the map is open and a grabbable object is targeted. Aim - Fixed a persistent pixel at the reticle center when pixelation was set to "Medium" in settings. Chat - Fixed pressing the enter key whilst chat is open and hovering over a button causing the button to be clicked. Vertical Aim - Fixed "Invert Vertical Aim" not working when spectating. Value UI - Fixed occasional flicker of lines above text. Settings - Fixed multiple close sounds sometimes playing on the settings page. Headman Manor - Fixed multiple level issues. Swiftbroom Academy - Fixed multiple level issues. Museum of Human Art - Fixed multiple level issues. Optimized memory usa...

title: WE FOUND A R.E.P.O. HUMAN SURVIVOR! (And Q&A Questions!)
contents: Hey hey semibots! Today‚Äôs video introduces the very first and important introduction of a HUMAN SURVIVOR, together with the final Q&A before THE MONSTER UPDATE launches next week on October 30th! For those of you who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video, here are some important key questions: Q: Which monster was the hardest to make? A: This is kind of hard to answer. They all have their own challenges and things to solve. Q: Will skins be added in this update? A: Not in this update, but we are looking into it. Q: Do you intend to put boss monsters in the game? Special monsters that appear every X levels. A: Yes there has been talks about boss monsters, but nothing is set in stone. Q: Will any monsters have special interactions with items or things that only the player can use? A: Depending on what this question means, one of the upcoming monsters can interact with items in a way. So yes and no. Q: What is your favorite monster in R.E.P.O.? A: The majority of the people at Semiwork would say Headman, he was the first monster created, being in the game back when the R.E.P.O. project was known as ‚ÄúClean‚Äù. Q: Will older monsters get new updated abilities, like the Huntsman saying things to make players laugh. A: We have no plans on changing the original monsters, they‚Äôre good as they are. Q: Will you add cosmetics for monsters? A: We haven‚Äôt thought about it, but it sounds like fun! So maybe. Q: How do you make the sounds and voices for the monsters? A: Robin is responsible for all sounds in the game. People in the office or friends sometimes make voices and then Robin tinkers with his sound magic. Q: Will there be different monster variations, like a snow model for them in McJannek Station? A: That would be really fun to do. We will put it on our very long ‚Äúfun-to-do list‚Äù. Q: Will you add equipment or upgrades that can only found on levels (not buyable in shop) A: This is another one of those ‚Äúwould be fun to do‚Äù. This is a maybe, for now! Q: Will there be new semibot expressions? A: No, not in this update. Bye bye! /semiwork

title: TEASING the NEW MONSTERS coming to R.E.P.O.
contents: Hey hey semibots! In this week‚Äôs devlog, we are talking about NEW MONSTERS, NEW VALUABLES and MORE upcoming exciting things that‚Äôll arrive in the upcoming Monster Update (Launching October 30th)! And for those who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video: Scary new monsters The Monster Update will, you guessed it, include several new monsters. We are very adamant that each new monster feels unique and unlike all the other monsters already available. We‚Äôre aiming for each monster to be scary, funny or both. Lots of new valuables We‚Äôve gone back to the older levels and made a lot of new valuables for each level, meaning that each level will now have its own unique themed valuables (like the Museum‚Äôs valuables). Some of these valuables also have some fun and interesting interactions! More areas/rooms in The Museum The Museum of Human Art is getting new rooms and areas for you to explore - everything from cozy campfire sites to gritty eroded hallways. Golden Joystick Awards We have been nominated for ‚ÄúBest Early Access Game‚Äù at the Golden Joystick Awards and we are very humbled and thankful for this. We‚Äôve had a crazy year and we are just so happy to have such a loving community along the ride! If you want to vote for us, you can do so on this link: https://www.gamesradar.com/goldenjoystickawards/ Fortnitemares 2025 Yes, the rumors are true. The Semibots joins the Fortnite fray this October! More information on this will come a bit later, but for now you can check out the gameplay trailer here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AlABOZhCCqU Bye bye! /semiwork

title: R.E.P.O. is nominated for a GOLDEN JOYSTICK!
contents: Hey hey semibots! We‚Äôre nominated for a Golden Joystick Award in the "Best Early Access Game" category!!! We are very honored by the nomination and would be grateful if you took a moment to vote for us! https://www.gamesradar.com/goldenjoystickawards/ It has been a wild year for us and we are all so thankful for our sweet community

title: R.E.P.O. v0.2.2
contents: FIXES FIXES Minor security update.

title: REPO devs are adding a new mechanic that'll let you grab things while tumbling and‚Äîmore importantly‚Äîkill things with butt physics
contents: REPO's monster update is already shaping up to be a big one. First, Semiwork confirmed we'll finally be able to speak through our disembodied heads. Today, however, the developer revealed a new feature that‚Äîby its own estimation‚Äîcould screw the entire game up... Read more.

title: This NEW FEATURE might BREAK our GAME
contents: Hey hey semibots! In this week‚Äôs devlog, we are showcasing a new upcoming feature that will arrive with our Monster Update launching October 30th! And for those who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video: New gameplay mechanic revealed ‚Äì TUMBLE GRAB! Arriving with The Monster Update on October 30th, you‚Äôll be able to TUMBLE GRAB! While in tumble (Q), you can now grab things! Items, weapons ‚Äì you name it! Wait for the red outlines to become yellow and you can even grab walls and climb. This ability is based off of your stamina ‚Äì the more stamina you have, the better! Tumble Grab also means that you can grab stuff in situations you previously couldn‚Äôt ‚Äì for example, if you‚Äôre levitated by the vicious Mentalist, you can grab a weapon and fight back! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: You can finally scream at your friends once you've died in REPO thanks to one of the most requested features being added in its upcoming update
contents: REPO's monster update is already promising a significant amount of new content for the co-op horror when it launches on October 30, but one of the most exciting features doesn't have anything to do with the new beasts. As shared in the newest video uploaded on the Semiwork YouTube channel, you'll now be able to speak through your head even once it's been flung off your body. So, I guess it does have something to do with the monsters in the game. Though I swear I've still lost my head because of my friends more than any of the creatures roaming around... Read more.

title: HIGHLY REQUESTED feature coming to R.E.P.O.!
contents: Hey hey semibots! This week we are showcasing one of the exciting new features in our upcoming Monster Update launching October 30th! And for those who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video: New gameplay mechanic revealed! Arriving with The Monster Update on October 30th, you‚Äôll finally be able to communicate from spectator mode, possessing your death head to talk and interact with alive semibots. While in spectator mode, wait for the battery to charge up, and then take control of your death head! You can also JUMP while you have control over your death head, but be aware that this drains more battery! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: Semiwork gets all mysterious about REPO's new monsters ahead of the next update
contents: REPO announced that a monster update would be coming at the end of October not too long ago, and have followed up with a video answering some of the questions players are throwing its way. Unfortunately though, if you wanted any sort of insight to what new monsters we can expect to face, or how many are being added, I've got some bad news. Semiwork will not be dishing out any information on how many monsters are coming, or their appearance, ahead of time... Read more.

title: REPO has announced its next update, but we actually have a date this time, rather than a series of videos to slowly announce it
contents: REPO will be rolling out another update next month on October 30, and a new video uploaded to the official semiwork YouTube channel has revealed that the main focus will be on new monsters. In classic semiwork style, though, this is all that has been shared so far, and we've been left with the promise that more information is "coming very, very soon"... Read more.

title: REVEALING THE NEXT UPDATE
contents: Hey hey semibots!We are back from semisummer and ready to reveal the next big update! As a celebration R.E.P.O. is also 30% off for a week! And for those who‚Äôd like to read instead of watching the video, here are some key points: Next Update Revealed ‚Äì Launching October 30th: Will contain brand new monsters, exciting new gameplay mechanics and more things to be revealed in the near future! R.E.P.O. is 30% off on Steam right now! From August 29th (Today) until September 5th! Devlog Schedule Change: Devlogs will now be every other Friday (instead of every Friday), but on the off-Fridays, there will be a so called Community video (Q&As, reacting to community creations, and other fun stuff). Discord Ping Tip: If the video ping announcements in Discord bother you, you can mute the server to stop the pings. And don‚Äôt worry, important Devlogs will always be accompanied by a Steam post, so you won‚Äôt miss out on important information about R.E.P.O. Q&A Next Friday: Leave your questions about the upcoming update in the comments section of this YouTube Video, and we‚Äôll address as many as we can on Friday September 5th. Bye bye! /semiwork

title: R.E.P.O. v0.2.1
contents: NEW FIXES NEW Splash Screen - Game now displays our logo and a photosensitivity warning. Skip with any input after the first time! Photosensitivity Setting - Added toggle to disable Boom Box color pulses, Gumball Machine overlay, Stun Grenade and Extraction Point lights and warning. FIXES "Stuck in Loading" Error - Previously forced exit to main menu now offers an option instead. Multiplayer - Fixed a couple hacker vulnerabilities. Menu Invite - Fixed issue where menu invite button did nothing for players with Steam Overlay disabled. Steam Overlay Joining - Fixed bug where the game got stuck when joining via the Steam Overlay from some menus.

title: R.E.P.O. has CHANGED FOREVER!
contents: Hey hey semibots!With the new update finally released, this week we are celebrating and showcasing some of the changes! Bye bye!/semiwork

title: It took a while but the excellent co-op horror game R.E.P.O. just got a major content update
contents: The Museum Update is the first major update to R.E.P.O since it entered Early Access in February. Read the full article here: https://www.gamingonlinux.com/2025/06/it-took-a-while-but-the-excellent-co-op-horror-game-r-e-p-o-just-got-a-major-content-update/

title: R.E.P.O. v0.2.0 - The Museum Update
contents: Hey hey semibots! Thank you all for being so patient, we have finally released our first major update! Have fun!! /semiwork NEW CHANGES BALANCING FIXES NEW A whole new level, Museum of Human Art! Server List and Random Matchmaking! Expressions - Use the number keys to express yourself, configurable in settings! Region Picker - Choose your server region, or keep automatic selection as before! Moon Phases - Shifts every 5 levels, raising difficulty and adding effects like Overcharge. Only a few moons are available for now, with more planned! View active moons in the escape menu. Overcharge - Only active in later moon phases. Grabbing an enemy builds Overcharge. When the meter is full you get blasted back! Stronger enemies generate more Overcharge. If multiple players grab the same enemy, the Overcharge is greatly reduced. Kick - Remove players from a lobby or during a level, preventing them from rejoining. Lobby Passwords - Private lobbies can now be password protected for security! Steam - Click player heads in lobby or icons next to mic sliders to open their Steam profile! Steam - Players now appear in your "recently played with" list after playing together. Toggle Mute - Press "B" to quickly mute or unmute your microphone. Can be configured in settings. New upgrade - Crouch Rest! New upgrade - Tumble Wings! New item - Pulse Pistol! New item - Boltzap! New item - Photon Blaster! New item - Prodzap! New item - Duck Bucket! New Item - C.A.R.T. Cannon! New Item - C.A.R.T. Laser! New item - Phase Bridge! New battery UI - Every stock on the battery now represents one use. New gameplay setting - Invert vertical aim! Extraction Points now feature a new warning graphic during the countdown, highlighting what valuables are at risk of being destroyed! CHANGES Microphone - Now stays active slightly longer on death for more death scream action, then briefly mutes to allow spectators to also experience the cutoff. Spectate - No longer collides with enemies. Spectate - Value now shown when spectating a player holding an item. Info UI - Adjusted to reduce overlap with inventory UI. Level Loading - Improved some loading graphics. Lobby Invite - Button now opens the Steam invite window instead of the Friends overlay. Charge Station - Added segmented bar for easier reading. Sledgehammer - Updated hit sound. Drones - Drones that can attach to both players and objects now more accurately target nearby objects when players are close. Rubber Duck - No longer does little idle jumps in the Shop or Truck level. Ranged Weapons - Strength no longer affects stability. Ranged weapons no longer become more stable with higher strength or twitchy at very high strength. Ranged Weapons - Can no longer misfire inside the truck. Gun - Updated some sounds. Map - Lowered volume of other players' maps. Enemies - Adjusted behavior when attempting to leave, they should now respond more dynamically to player actions. Enemies - Valuable condition to stun an enemy is now based on mass, instead of size. Enemy Upscream - Textures now have more detail. Enemy Trudge - Lights now have shadows and do not bleed through walls. Enemy Chef - Now has death effects and sounds. Enemy Robe - Now plays a death sound. Leaves if stuck too long without reaching a player. Forced Aim - Now blends into default sensitivity and smoothness to avoid impacting gameplay. Physic Grabber - Logic has been tweaked to not cause so much jittery motions when player strength is increased. Weapons have been tweaked to handle better as well. Physic Grabber - Rotation now has sounds! Truck - Improved some colliders. Flashlight - Should now give better contact shadows. Death Pits - Objects that survive death pits now show an effect. Server Connection - Now uses different ports to help with rare connection issues. Headman Manor - Visible moon graphics removed from outdoor rooms. Swiftbroom Academy - Added visible ceiling fence to outdoor areas. Swiftbroom Academy - Removed emission from potion bottle props so they stand out less. Swiftbroom Academy - Replaced padlocks with planks on blocked furniture and doors. Fridge - Improved textures in Headman Manor and McJannek Station for more detail. BALANCING Crouching - Regenerates stamina faster, especially when stationary. Difficulty - Now scales beyond level 10. Level size, enemy count and extraction goal increase per level. Truck Healer - Now gives 50 health from the start, but will decrease with moon phases. Level Value - Total value is now more consistent across levels. Hiding - You can now talk a bit more before enemies hear you. Enemies - All enemies now attack players making sounds when very close. Enemies - Some enemies are now heavier when stunned. Enemies - Reduced chance of duplicate enemies in late game. Enemy Orbs - Removed limit of 10. Enemy Grabbing - Enemies break free more slowly when held by multiple players. Enemy Valuable Damage - Now loses a set percentage of initial value when used to damage enemies. Enemy Gnomes/Bangers -...

title: REPO devs are planning something diabolical for the upcoming museum map: 'Get ready to Mission: Impossible your way past laser security modules'
contents: REPO's big update has been in the works for a few months now. As well as providing a new way to deal with one of the most annoying monsters‚Äîthe duck‚Äîthis update will add a whole new and massive map... Read more.

title: 50 RAPID QUESTIONS with R.E.P.O. DEV
contents: Hey hey semibots!This week we are answering a final batch of questions from our discord before the update releases! We have a Discord Quest active right now until the 24th of June! Grab the Discord Quest here: https://discord.com/quests/1383204882638700714 Here's the Q and A for you that prefer text:Discord Collaboration‚ùì Discord Quest? üí¨ Yes‚Äîit‚Äôs live right now (gnomes not invited) and runs until 24 June.‚ùì But what‚Äôs in it for me? üí¨ Play Repo for 15 minutes with Discord running to unlock the exclusive ‚ÄúI ‚ù§ Repo‚Äù avatar decoration.‚ùì Oh my lord, how can I get this Discord Quest? üí¨ Hit the link in the above (or the one Discord has already sent it to you).Gameplay & Content‚ùì Will there be any upgrades for the carts? üí¨ Absolutely‚Äî If you count the Cart Cannon and Cart Laser as cart upgrades.‚ùì Will we ever get team-wide shared upgrades? üí¨ It‚Äôs high on our ‚Äúwould-be-cool‚Äù list.‚ùì Is an outdoor map in development? üí¨ Not actively, but it‚Äôs definitely on that same ‚Äúwould-be-cool‚Äù list.‚ùì Will other maps get museum-style, location-specific variations? üí¨ Yes‚Äîolder maps will be brought up to the museum‚Äôs standard over time.‚ùì After valuables run out, can they respawn? üí¨ No. If you smash everything and still can‚Äôt make quota, you‚Äôll need to accept defeat. We might look into some sort of life line though.‚ùì Will the museum include laser alarms? üí¨ Yep‚Äîget ready to Mission: Impossible your way past laser security modules.‚ùì Will there be more verticality in the museum map? üí¨ Tons. It‚Äôs a weird modern museum full of platforming and height changes.‚ùì Will there be new monsters in this update? üí¨ Not in Update 1, but existing monsters got balance tweaks.‚ùì Are completely new areas planned after the museum? üí¨ Yes‚Äînew area types are coming post-museum.‚ùì Will there be co-op puzzles or challenge rooms? üí¨ We‚Äôre experimenting with them; they won‚Äôt land in the first update. ‚ùì Will there be more set traps? üí¨ Not in Update 1, no.‚ùì Will the museum have any outdoor modules like Headman Manor? üí¨ Yes ‚Äî in the update after this one we will add some outside areas to the museum.‚ùì Can the onion in the chair at the museum become grabbable? üí¨ Why would you grab an onion? They‚Äôre toxic and could kill you!Weapons & Tools‚ùì Will there be more unique guns like the Photon Blaster? üí¨ Definitely‚ÄîUpdate 1 adds several brand-new, one-of-a-kind weapons.‚ùì Will you make the Cart Cannon aim vertically? üí¨ You already can‚Äîjust grab and rotate it (a bit wonky, but it works). ‚ùì Will there be instruments or noisemakers just for fun?üí¨ Maybe someday ‚Äî sounds fun, but we‚Äôd need anti-troll safeguards for public lobbies.Graphics & Performance‚ùì Will there be ‚Äúpotato‚Äù graphics options? üí¨ Repo already runs well on low-end machines, but dynamic shadows are core to the game, so true ‚Äúpotato‚Äù mode isn‚Äôt planned.Cosmetics & Expressions‚ùì Will there be dancing or emotes? üí¨ Discussed, but for this update we focused on new facial expressions.‚ùì Will there be more expressions? üí¨ We added everything that felt essential; modders will no doubt add more.‚ùì Is there a possibility for custom facial expressions? üí¨ You can already combine several expressions at once; for deeper customisation, mods are your friend.‚ùì Will cart skins be a thing? üí¨ Maybe‚Äîif demand is there we‚Äôll look into it during the cosmetics pass.‚ùì Will we ever get the twerk emote? üí¨ Unsure the semibots have enough junk in the trunk for that one! ‚ùì Will you add kissing and touching hands into R.E.P.O.? üí¨ No need ‚Äî you can already kiss (do a kiss sound and slam your head into your friend) and hold a hand (grab the hand valuable in the museum) in-game.‚ùì Will there be toggleable player expressions? üí¨ Already in! Just tap once to toggle an expression instead of holding the button.Monetisation‚ùì Will there be a Repo Battle Pass, Premium, NFTs, loot boxes, etc.? üí¨ No. You buy the game once, you have the game‚Äîno micro-transactions ever.Audio & Art‚ùì Will there be new music? üí¨ Yes‚ÄîRobin composed an entirely new soundtrack for the museum.‚ùì Can you add fan art to the museum gallery? üí¨ Legal headaches make that tough, but we‚Äôre planning other ways to showcase community art. ‚ùì What‚Äôs your favourite art in the museum? üí¨ Sir Semibotsworth III ‚Äì an actual painting hanging in our office, and it‚Äôs glorious.‚ùì What inspired the museum‚Äôs overall look and interior? üí¨ We toured modern museums, then asked ‚Äúwhat if this place were abandoned?‚Äù (plus a field-trip to a toy museum to study valuables).Lore‚ùì Why did you rename Avant Guard to the Museum of Human Art? üí¨ Play-testers called it ‚Äúthe museum‚Äù anyway, and the new name fits the lore you‚Äôll piece together.‚ùì Will there be more lore to discover in the museum? üí¨ Absolutely‚Äîexplore thoroughly! ‚ùì Are the dev-log skits canon to the R.E.P.O. timeline?üí¨ Treat the skits as official Semiwork-studio lore; the real game canon is inside R.E.P.O. itself.Quality-of-Life & Tutorials‚ùì Will the devs add an interactive tutorial for me? üí¨ It‚Äôs already in‚Äîplease do it!‚ùì Will there be a public matchmaking / server list? üí¨ Yes...

title: R.E.P.O. BRAINROT SHRUNK MY BRAIN!

title: REPO 'literally saved semiwork as a studio' according to a new video published by developers
contents: In a recent video published by semiwork about REPO's first update, developers shared a little insight into how they've responded to the sudden success of their co-op horror game. As it turns out, its popularity took the team by complete surprise and in a way was the saving grace semiwork needed to continue as a game studio... Read more.

title: REPO has published yet another video promising more content in its long-awaited first update: 'We are in the homestretch now'
contents: In a completely unsurprising turn of events, Semiwork has published another video about REPO's first update. With that said, it looks like these video diaries are coming to an end, since this week's episode began with an apology directed toward players voicing their desperation for any sort of release date, and the caption "we are in the home stretch now" on Steam... Read more.

title: WE'RE SORRY - AGAIN?!
contents: Hey hey semibots! We are in the homestretch now, this week we are showing off some new cool items! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: REPO will feature 'moon phases' as part of the new update, ramping up the difficulty every 5 levels
contents: REPO has been gearing up for its first significant update for a while now, and alongside new levels and weapons, it's also introducing difficulty-based progression.. In a video published by semiwork, this new system has been explained in more detail, clearing up any confusion from previous videos and sharing the changes that have been made since it was first hinted at... Read more.

title: Moon Phases coming soon to R.E.P.O.
contents: Hey hey semibots! We're still hard at work on the new update. This video gives you a lil more info on what's to come! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: REPO developer teases the game's 'most powerful weapon' yet, a mountable cannon that will 'turn your cart into a battle tank'
contents: REPO's latest community update video made me laugh so hard that the top half of my head almost fully flapped backward, much like the yapping mouths of the game's own pedal bin-shaped robots. This wasn't due to the video's typically goofy opening, though I did crack a slight smile at the introductory silliness. Rather, it's because presenter and semiwork designer Pontus spends the first half of the update talking about balance, then reveals a new weapon so powerful it risks obliterating the concept of balance from reality... Read more.

title: Most POWERFUL weapon in R.E.P.O. yet!
contents: Hey hey semibots! This week we are talking a bit more about our upcoming balancing changes as well as showing off a POWERFUL new weapon! Bye bye! /semiwork

contents: The devs behind co-op horror game REPO have laid out a decision they've made after player feedback from their latest open beta update: they're going to make the Overcharge mechanic that penalizes players grabbing onto monsters something that only kicks in after 10 levels of play... Read more.

title: Let's do something about OVERCHARGE!
contents: Hey hey semibots! This week we are sharing some of our changes to address the Beta feedback, huge thanks for testing and letting us know your bugs and feedback - helps us out a lot! Bye bye! /semiwork

title: How to access the open beta for the new REPO update
contents: REPO has been advertising its first content update for a while now, and plenty of Q&A videos have shared what exactly we can expect to see from it. But, one piece of information that hasn't been shared is the release date. Fortunately, the new REPO update is now available for beta test, and there's no need to register your interest or sign up in order to get access to it... Read more.

The update still has some stuff missing and some potential bugs, but now you can help us finalize it! See you in public matchmaking! /semiwork

title: REPO will never be free-to-play 'as we don't want to add microtransactions', say devs‚Äîhinting at earned cosmetics in the future
contents: Semiwork has announced that REPO will never be free-to-play, a promise meant to avoid ever featuring microtransactions within the game. As it stands, everything you need to play, even including personalisable flourishes like customising the color of your robot, is standard-issue or unlockable with in-game currency... Read more.

title: A mimic monster may come to REPO in the future, but it has to be 'really interesting' before it does
contents: In semiwork's recent Q&A, the question of whether or not mimics would ever come to REPO was answered, and you'll be pleased to know that it was a very firm "maybe." But since this isn't really a confirmation, nor is it a solid no, no details on how they'd work or what exactly this would mean in REPO were shared... Read more.

title: Co-op horror game REPO is a viral sensation, but is it here to stay?
contents: As I write this, REPO just exceeded 100,000 reviews on Steam. 96% of them are positive. Think about that - in this era of social media outrage factories, 96% of people agreed that something (anything) is good. Released in late February, REPO is still sitting in Steam's top ten most played titles almost two months later. Not a bad outcome for a studio whose approach to this release was "let's just fail quickly this time," after its previous releases failed to find an audience. Read the rest of the story... RELATED LINKS: New co-op horror hit has more players than GTA 5 and Apex Legends on Steam Viral co-op horror game REPO is already a hit with a 97% Steam rating

contents: It's happened again, another PC game has been ripped from Steam and put onto the Nintendo eShop by a third party. A few months ago, the victim was a Backrooms game, but this time it's REPO that has been ripped off... Read more.

That's alongside information about modding, details on new multiplayer features, new customisation for your robot, and information on the upcoming level... Read more.

title: R.E.P.O. DEVS answer MORE of YOUR QUESTIONS!
contents: Salutations semibots! This week we are answering more of your burning questions posted on our Discord server! Farewell to you! /semiwork

title: How to deal with the duck in REPO
contents: REPO is home to a band of intimidating monsters, and the duck isn't exactly one that immediately screams terror. But despite its tiny size and cute appearance, this creature actually poses quite a threat. The duck is actually referred to as the Apex Predator in REPO and for good reason. After all, one wrong move can bring your game to a swift end... Read more.

title: The best REPO mods: add more monsters, Mimics, and fashion to the creepy co-op company sim
contents: The co-op creepy company sim, REPO, is officially on my long list of beloved spooky pastimes with friends, accompanied by other horror games like Phasmophobia and Lethal Company. Much like the latter, there's quite a scene for fan-made customizations, and we've drummed up a list of some of the best REPO mods to check out before loading up the truck... Read more.

title: All drones in REPO and what they do
contents: REPO has a bounty of items for you to get acquainted with, and drones are one of the many tools designed to make your extractions slightly easier to manage. They can be pretty expensive items to purchase, especially early on in the game, but are well worth the money once you know how to use them correctly... Read more.

title: How to tumble launch in REPO
contents: When you can't quite afford a weapon between levels in REPO, learning how to tumble launch is your next best bet. It's your key to quickly avoiding monsters, and if timed right, you can also use this move to cause damage to your enemies. But one wrong move in REPO can result in instant death depending on which monster you're facing, so the tumble launch can be a risky move to pull off sometimes... Read more.

title: 'Let's just fail quickly this time': Semiwork took a 'big risk' on REPO after its first game took 6 years to make and didn't sell very well
contents: The co-op horror game REPO is, like Schedule I, a surprise indie hit. Released in February, it's got an "overwhelmingly positive" rating across more than 91,000 user reviews on Steam and remains near the top of its most-played chart: As I write this, nearly 170,000 people are playing... Read more.

title: How R.E.P.O. was CREATED!
contents: Hey semibots! Time for our weekly update video‚Äîspecial edition: The Making of R.E.P.O. We‚Äôre still working hard on our next update, stay tuned for more info on that in next week‚Äôs video! /semiwork

title: REPO: how many players can join
contents: REPO is only getting more popular, so if your friends have been badgering you to play you might be wondering how many players can join a game. After all, it's always useful to have more hands on deck when it comes to scouring every nook and cranny for hidden valuables, or even taking down some of the horrendous monsters that lurk in the shadows. With that said, you don't need a certain number of players to host a game, so even if you want to go in on your own, nothing is stopping you... Read more.

title: How to heal and revive your teammates in REPO
contents: If you've played any amount of REPO, you'll want to know how to heal and how to revive your teammates. Given the amount of monsters that will inevitably swarm you during a run, keeping your health up and your teammates together is essential for that all-important valuable haul. There are bound to be some sacrifices and friends lost along the way, but that doesn't mean they're ruled out of playing for good... Read more.

title: How to get and use Energy Crystals in REPO
contents: It's easy to go without extra energy in those first few levels of REPO, but you'll need some sort of power source for expensive new weapons as things ramp up. That's where Energy Crystals come in, providing a finite number of charges for your Semibot's growing arsenal... Read more.

title: REPO monster list: Every terror you can face
contents: If you've spent any time running around gathering valuables in REPO , you will have come across some of its many monsters. As if scrabbling to scrounge up money wasn't hard enough; these prowling creatures try to kill you and your friends and destroy your loot in the process. Dealing with them isn't made any easier by the fact each level has a random selection of monsters, so you'll need to learn about each if you want to make it out alive... Read more.

title: REPO dev says it wasn‚Äôt actually inspired by Lethal Company, and started as a singleplayer cleaning game: ‚ÄòIt was nice, but far from what REPO is now‚Äô
contents: You‚Äôd be forgiven for thinking REPO is a lot like Lethal Company. Both games involve fetching precious objects, hiding from things that go bump in the night, working cooperatively as nigh-identical, disposable grunts, and hollering over voice chat when things inevitably go wrong. Both games are also overnight phenomena, with REPO scrambling to adjust to its massive success and garnering the attention of Lethal Company‚Äôs very own creator... Read more.

title: New co-op horror hit has more players than GTA 5 and Apex Legends on Steam
contents: REPO has spent the last few weeks growing on Steam, and now it's one of the biggest games on Valve's platform. The spooky indie is so big, in fact, that it just beat out the likes of GTA 5 Enhanced and Stardew Valley, as players band together to make some cash in the Lethal Company-style online experience. In a year filled with surprises, REPO joins the club. Read the rest of the story... title: EXCITING THINGS coming to R.E.P.O.
contents: We're working hard on our first update, constantly considering your feedback and finding new ways to communicate with you. One of the best ways we've found is our weekly update videos. We have some new features and a new map to show you: Thank you all for giving us the chance to make R.E.P.O. the very best it can be! /semiwork

It's a combination that has proved wildly popular, with REPO currently positioned as the fourth highest-selling game on Steam... Read more.

title: R.E.P.O. is a new co-op horror game with silly physics currently exploding on Steam
contents: With a Steam image of a stupid smiley face that made me initially ignore it when seeing it (the kind I would expect from some basic cheapo game), R.E.P.O. is actually pretty darn amusing and it's rocketing up the charts on Steam. Read the full article here: https://www.gamingonlinux.com/2025/03/r-e-p-o-is-a-new-co-op-horror-game-with-silly-physics-currently-exploding-on-steam/

title: R.E.P.O. peaks at 271k players
contents: R.E.P.O. has peaked at 271,571 concurrent players on 23 March 2025 just 25 days after release. View charts and more statistics on our website.

title: R.E.P.O. v0.1.2
contents: CHANGES CHANGES We've temporarily set all lobbies to "Friends Only" to prevent hackers from joining random games. In the near future we plan to introduce a server browser for players who prefer to play with randoms. We appreciate your patience as we work toward a permanent solution! Thank you all for enjoying R.E.P.O. we are truly overwhelmed by the amazing response to our game, we are looking forward to keep building the game together with this amazing new community

title: Viral co-op horror game REPO is already a hit with a 97% Steam rating
contents: If you're looking for the next perfect way to virtually scare your friends so hard they land in 2026, REPO is it. Steam's newest social horror game has a bit of Lethal Company about it, but twists the formula with in-game physics that make every action a dance with death. Players are already raving about it, and you can grab REPO for yourself at a 20% discount for a limited time. Read the rest of the story...

title: R.E.P.O. v0.1.1
contents: FIXES FIXES A fix for some players failing to connect to voice chat. Thank you all for enjoying R.E.P.O.

title: R.E.P.O. IS OUT NOW!
contents: Thank you and hope you are all enjoying our game! /semiwork
